Reviews.Title: Do not use in environments with...lots of colors
Reviews.Author: narf
Reviews.Content: Just throwing in my 2 cents - had two of these and a few Foscam FI8910W cameras all set to install, tested them at home (in my fairly drab house) and they worked fine.  Went to install them in a colorful environment and they all failed - they would boot up, be able to be pinged for about 10 seconds, and then reboot.Seems to be the same problem mentioned here:  http://www.amazon.com/review/R30GQV3F3C8KGX/ref=cm_cr_pr_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN;=B006ZP8UOW&linkCode;=&nodeID;=&tag;=Returning this and going to buy something that isn't some janky Chinese nonsense.

Reviews.Title: My cheapo nanny/baby cam from Target has better picture quality. Serious!
Reviews.Author: Cajundude
Reviews.Content: I'm kicking myself for waiting a month to install this camera and now its too late to return. The software install and connections was straight forward and only took about 10-15 minutes but you can only adjust the brightness and contrast and no matter how you set them the picture quality is VERY poor. When you first see the picture of our driveway you think its a great picture but once you try to make out someone walking by or even read the license plate of a car 20 feet in front of the camera you realize just how poor the quality is. We had someone steal one of our solar landscape lights 20 feet in front of the camera and all I can tell you is that it was a white male. It could have been my brother and I there's no way I would have recognized him. Its that bad! Now for the lighting issue. During the day the cement street is just a bright glare and you can't make out anything. If you adjust the brightness for that the rest of the yard looks like dusk. At night the IR is very powerful. In fact its so powerful that when someone walks up looking straight at the camera they look like a glowing ghost except they are glowing so bright that you can't make them out. Again if you adjust the brightness down and bump the contrast up to compensate you can't see more than 30-40 feet away. We ended up comparing the video of my wife walking across our yard about 30 feet away from this camera with that from a $75 nanny cam from Target and the nanny cam looked 200% better. Better color, sharpness, better everything. That's just how bad this camera is!

Reviews.Title: decent device - abyssimal customer support.
Reviews.Author: Ed Stevens
Reviews.Content: Initial setup and quality of camera seemed very good.  However, when I tried to configure some additional features like email alerts on motion detection, customer support was AWOL.  Interminable waits on phone calls, online forum support was only responded by other customers who had simplistic answers indicating they never actually paid attention to what I was saying, and the online chat with support would disconnect after 5 minutes of inactivity after their initial "welcome" and my initial response -- that's disconnecting the customer after 5 minutes of inactivity while the ball was in *their* court!  Thirty minutes of research on the web -- even on their own customer support forum -- turned up that this was 'business as usual' for Foscam.  I work in IT as a systems admin, so am no stranger to the technology of what I was trying to configure with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: R. W. Six "R6"
Reviews.Content: This is a great unit.  I do have some experience as a software engineer, so the setup was straight forward for me.  I can see where someone would be frustrated, but the tools are all there.  I am very pleased with the quality of the picture and the distance the WiFi will pickup and maintain the signal.

Reviews.Title: Weak Wireless Signal - Foscam IP Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Jaime Hernandez "Jaime Hernandez, The Cyber F...
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for this camera. It looks professional and the specs were all there. However, after one day of use, the wireless signal has quit and after being on the phone with the Foscam tech support, I have come to the conclusion that the product is complete junk. I have three very high powered Unifi Access Points in my 2000 sq ft home...overkill as far as the wireless network is concerned. It cannot stay connected. Do a quick search for the poor wireless signal problem and you will find many others with the same problem. I now have it temporarily set up with a hard ethernet wire until the new one is shipped to me. I am going to try the Power Over Ethernet camera made by Foscam in hopes that it will stay connected. I will post my findings.

Reviews.Title: Good idea, but poorly made and terrible picture
Reviews.Author: Just a guy
Reviews.Content: This is a good idea.  It has a nice shade hood and a wall bracket.  The wire is fixed to the back and it has three pigtails - one for power, ethernet and a reset button.Problems:1) the attachment for the antenna broke off - could not screw the antenna on because the part you screw the antenna onto broke off2) when it works, the wireless range was terrible - maybe 30 feet through drywall3) the picture is TERRIBLE - everything is a shade of grey - there is almost no color4) the mount itself has screws to tighten the position, but they are barely strong enough to hold the weight of the camera5) mine was missing the power adapter in the box - it uses a regular 5v plug - I had others laying aroundThe good:The night vision on this is excellent.  The LED's glow red at night and it really throws off a lot of infrared light.  It had no problem lighting up the whole front area of my house (maybe 75 feet distance)I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8905W Outdoor Wireless/Wired IP Camera 12 mm Lens
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Bobbi Ann"
Reviews.Content: These FOSCAM Outdoor Cameras are great for the price.  The only problem I have with with the cameras is mounting.  The camera is to heavy for the mounting hardware.  Still trying to figure out alternate way to mount them.  Documentation, both PDF File & Booklet, are poorly written.  Have two FOSCAM indoor cameras and wish now I had bought Foscam FI8905W Outdoor Wireless/Wired Cameras instead.  For my use the 12 mm Lens are just right.Foscam FI8905W Outdoor Wireless/Wired IP Camera with 30 Meter Night Vision and 6mm Lens (42° Viewing Angle) - Silver

Reviews.Title: Don't expect too much...
Reviews.Author: Boris
Reviews.Content: I purchased this directly from foscam.us in hopes of getting better support (according to some other reviews). Ended up not needing it. This camera has good features at a good price point. Wireless connection, remote monitoring, alert triggers, relatively easy setup (if you have some experience with networks). But the picture QUALITY is absolute crap. A 6 year old cell phone has better video quality. One feature that is REALLY needed is automatic brightness control. When you set the brightness/contrast on a cloudy day, when the sun comes out the picture blooms so much you can't see anything (outdoor). Nighttime viewing (where image sharpness is always lacking), is OK. The IR light source does have good "throw" and illuminates a good distance. This camera would be adequate for indoor use, but for outdoors, it's seriously lacking in features and image quality.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work outside
Reviews.Author: mwalshe2000
Reviews.Content: They worked fine inside, but when turned outside during the day, I could see nothing, just a white screen.Even with the brightness set to 0, still no use outside.  I may have bought non orignal units, because when they arrivedthere was no mention of Foscam on the box. I returned both and got a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Good Outdoor Camera.
Reviews.Author: Hugo Oliveira "HuGhost"
Reviews.Content: As said before on other reviews, the mounting hardware could be better.The lens is not 12mm it's 8mm. In my case it was fine. Night vision is good at 30 feet out.The GUI is okay, could be better, but good enough and easy to figure out.Configuration is not bad, although it could be tricky for none tech types. If you follow the direction you'll be fine. I had it up and running in less then five minutes, and running with wireless G.Overall this is a good product. Would buy another.

Reviews.Title: Foscam needs to make some improvements to their design
Reviews.Author: Noelix
Reviews.Content: Biggest issue with this guy is that you have to perform a power reset on it every one to two weeks. It will just stop working randomly and you have to go out there and unplug it and plug it back in to get it to work.My other beef is the lack of clarity on faces in general, regardless if its day or night. Gives you an okay idea of the movement but not of facial features you could give to the police for example.

Reviews.Title: 3 month and died
Reviews.Author: Y. Torres
Reviews.Content: The camera only works for 3 months and now if you touch it, it will give you an electric shock.

Reviews.Title: Has exceeded my expectations so far
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: I have several other wireless security cameras, and this one has the best picture. It has worked flawlessly so far, and was easy to set up using the tool provided. I was also impressed with the heavy duty mount included. Much better than the others that came with those cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good only if you void the warranty
Reviews.Author: Russ J
Reviews.Content: "Stock" Foscam MJPEG cameras aren't worth the cardboard box they come in unless you're willing to hack them and fix the manufacturing defect Foscam won't fix.  There is a well-known issue with the ones produced 2012+ that causes them to reboot if the picture is too "busy" (i.e. bright sun, windy trees/grass, etc).When this camera *works*, it is a pretty good camera for the money.  Night vision is really good - almost too bright for things within 20 feet.  Unfortunately, you need to be comfortable re-flashing it (and voiding your warranty) in order to get it to work...

Reviews.Title: Garbage, do not buy
Reviews.Author: PNW Native
Reviews.Content: Camera hangs after a day or so of use during exposure to direct sunlight.  Needs to be power cycled to come back.  Garbage, returning to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Some Of These Have Problems.
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: We have bought 8 or 9 of these to get 5 that work.  They must have had a bad batch.  They work for about a day then once you get a sunny day, that's all she wrote.  It is well documented on the internet about the issue I describe.  I do like FOSCAM though.  We have 5 that work great and have also bought a Pan/Zoom 8919 that works great,  The ones that work I give a 5 Star.  This one got returned.

Reviews.Title: A Good Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of indoor Foscam IP cameras and I wanted to stick with the same brand. It's a good camera for the price. As with the other cameras the Web interface isn't stellar but I use an iOS app to view them from my phone and I also use Vitamin D Video to record video and manage notifications so I rarely access the Web interface after a camera has been setup.Image quality is good. You'll lose some quality at night when it's in infrared mode but that should be expected. I haven't had problems caused by the camera getting wet, as some reviewers have mentioned, but this camera is beneath an overhang so rain only hits it if it's very windy. It's connected to a secure wifi network (due to location).

Reviews.Title: Somewhat Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: M. Spaulding
Reviews.Content: I want to monitor some of my property at night and after much searching it seemed Foscam was the most popular IR camera manufacturer.I suppose these cameras are the low end of Foscam's line-up at $95 each and they do now have an hd version but at a much higher price.My largest disappointment with the camera is the video quality, out of the box the focus is almost unbearable. I contacted Foscam technical support about the focus, I have a lot of trouble understanding people with a strong accent so I started emailing them and they said there is no focus adjustment for this model. Well, after clicking through their website I found the focusing procedure which involves simply removing the lens cover, light board and rotating the lens. That helped but there is no way to get a real clear focus you just have to live with sub-par videos.I must comment a bit more about the technical support. I asked them a couple of questions about the video quality and it always came back to there must be something wrong with MY network or MY PC setup. I even connected the camera by a direct Ethernet wired connection through which I get Gigabit communication between the PC's in my house with no change in video quality. I have 2 of these cameras and they both are exactly the same. The video is not focused and is very pixelated, so bad I can't even recognize someone I know at 60' daytime much less at night.Like I said, $95 is a relatively inexpensive camera and maybe I'm expecting too much but the technical support is important to me, especially in this situation because I'm new to this and I did not have a very good experience. On the positive side, the cameras are solid, feel well built. They are easy to configure to the pc, they even have WPS capability, upgradeable firmware etc..Like I said the price of the cameras is to be considered, you get what you pay for and if the technical support had been acceptable I probably would have bought some of their upper grade models but I am probably going to look elsewhere next timeThanks,Mike

Reviews.Title: Camera does a good job, functions well
Reviews.Author: Michael Laferriere
Reviews.Content: I have one of these cameras attached to a tree outside of my house. Even the 6mm lens does seem slightly long if you plan on using it close up. This camera would seem better suited to be mounted on a second floor eave or set back from the area you wish to view. This would also help keep it vandal proof.The 8905 seems to have an excellent wifi chip built in. Using the stock antenna it can pick up numerous wifi networks that even my strategically placed router (with 9db antennas) is not able to see. I have never had a dropped signal and it works fine at the other end of the house.I have an older WRT54GS router running dd-wrt (an EXCELLENT firmware upgrade for Linsksys/Ciso & other routers) which handles the camera perfectly. The pnp opens up a port from the outside as needed and using the DDNS I can connect from a device outside my network with ease.I believe Foscam has begun using inhouse coders to generate firmware. The 8910 and 8905's use a very stable and functional firmware which they contract out. There have been issues with Foscam.com and Foscam.us having separate versions. This contracted firmware has all the features you will likely need. These include using an NTP (to set the camera's time), remote FTP (to save pictures remotely in case your camera walks off), and of course the ability to view live over the Internet. One small bug note, the NTP servers do not seem to handle Daylight savings time very well. You may have to either sync to PC (likely the time will wind up being way off within a day or two) or you can use the advance time by 60 minutes to correct this.The Foscam cameras allow you to create eight separate user logins with three levels of access. Visitors can sign in to the camera and watch whatever it is pointed at, operators, can sign in & watch while administrators can get in and alter settings remotely.The alarm settings are a bit on the primitive side. You have options to either trigger an alarm based on motion sensitivity. They have a setting for "motion compensation" but this doesn't seem to do too much. If you had the ability to pick parts of the screen to watch and ignore others, it would be far better. IE, if you are watching your driveway and the road behind it is in view, you might have to put up with false alarms every time a car drives down your street.  You also have the ability to set alarms on your own time & day schedule.The setup was not too bad at all, being a guy I skipped the directions and plugged an Ethernet cable directly between the camera and my router. Once I found the camera's IP address I was able to connect to it. Foscam provides a utility to do this which would have saved me a few minutes time as I went to my router to see what IP it gave the camera. Using the Foscam "IP Camera Tool" it will bring up a list of camera's on your local network.  Once you see your new camera you can merely double click on it and it will open a browser window to your camera. It will handle the port (defaults to the generic port 80) numbers for you. This way you can cut & paste your wifi password into the camera and then setup your security, change your passwords etc. and your good to go!I had to send my original 8905 back as it was stuck in day mode. Others have had these cameras stuck in the night mode all day. If it stays in the night mode, the colors will be mostly grey and the image will be partially washed out. If it is stuck in the day mode, you will not see anything at night. The camera uses a small relay which seems to stick sometimes. Sometimes you can get it functioning again by shining a bright light in it at night. If you hear the click-click, it will be functioning, if it is sticking, it will be silent or very muffled. Since I ordered mine on Amazon instead of directly through Foscam, I was able to get Amazon to replace it. Foscam seems aware of the issue, but since this is a hardware issue, there is very little that will likely change with firmware alone. This is why I held back one star on this review.All in all, a very good camera especially when you consider that some camera's with the same functions will cost many times what this little gem costs.

Reviews.Title: No reply after starting RMA
Reviews.Author: Andrew "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: I thought this is a good product based on review ranking, until i work with their customer service.My outdoor camera stop working somehow, i figure out its wifi part not working. So i ask foscam whether the wifi part can be repaired. I got quick response from Thomas Lee at foscam. He told me to contact their seller where i bought my camera - Foscam Amazon Marketplace.Again i got response quickly from foscam amazon marketplace. They issue me RMA, and ask me to ship back my camera, and start RMA process. But after i ship back the camera, i just didn't get any response from them. Even i have sent 3 emails to ask, no reply at all.Now it has been 6 weeks passed, seems nothing happen. I couldn't guess what's going on. At least they should let me know whether they have received the camera, whether the camera is worth to repair etc.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY- THESE DO NOT APPEAR TO BE ORIGINAL
Reviews.Author: NK
Reviews.Content: I have several FI8905W and these appear to be knockoffs or are surely not FI8905W. I purchased 2 of these.The IR does not work at all. Wireless does not connect. Missing stand for one of them. Forget about the night vision, even during day time you cannot see anything. Either the lens gets too bright or too dark. Setting the brightness or contrast does not help. I spent several hours adjusting them, but they do not work. Sending these back.Buy original from Foscam.

Reviews.Title: F18905W Web Cam
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great and it automatically changes from color to black and white for night infrared pictures or recording. Many features are included that you can customize. Used the technical support line and was very satisfied with the support.

Reviews.Title: too difficult
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Oakley "kim adams"
Reviews.Content: even a computer savvy person is going to have to spend some time with this item, unable to hook up to either computer, either phone, spent over 2 HOURS with support tech person and she couldn't complete the project, she was to call me back the next day and havent heard anything in 2-3 days, going to return it. thank goodness amazon makes it easy to return this item.

Reviews.Title: Poor wireless
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I returned the first one because wireless would not connect after trying on multiple networks. Works perfectly if connected to Ethernet however.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, but view angle is too narrow
Reviews.Author: Jon Vogel "Jon Vogel"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to monitor my driveway.  I'd purchased the Foscam FI8910W and was impressed by it, so I gave this one a shot.  Installation was easy and the instructions straight forward.  Here are my impressions of the camera:Construction was very solid with an aluminum shell and separate shield over the top.  Felt very sturdy.  Was much larger than I expected.The mounting bracket is flimsy and should be replaced by a better quality one.The Ethernet connector on the end of the power cable was huge.  I had to drill a 1-inch hole to feed it through the wall.I purchased the optional power cable extender.  That worked well.The biggest problem with the camera is the view angle.  Once I had the camera setup and mounted, I was shocked at how useless the view was.  It was way too narrow and could only show a small part of my driveway.  For surveillance purposes, it was a bust.  I went ahead and purchased a 3rd party wide angle lens to see if that improves it.  But, this was not want I was expecting for an outdoor surveillance camera.  About all it is useful for, out of the box, is maybe for monitoring an entryway.  This last problem is why I gave this product only 3 stars instead of 5.  It's an excellently built device that simply doesn't quite do what I needed it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great IP Cam for the price.
Reviews.Author: seapea
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price of this camera. Before purchasing this camera I had 3 Panasonic IP cams that all cost over $200. For less than $100, this camera better suits my purposes than the Panasonic cameras. This camera can see at night, my Panasonic cameras cannot. The Panasonic cameras have audio and pan, tilt,zoom. To me the night vision was more important than the features the Panasonic cameras offered. As far as image quality, they are about the same. The Panasonic cameras might be a little better, but not enough to warrant spending $100+ more.

Reviews.Title: Follow up Service -
Reviews.Author: E Broker Group
Reviews.Content: I had to call back today and get help setting up the remote viewer. All went smooth and we are up and running. Very happy with the support. The interface seems to work well with the android phones that we have. I think I will be adding these cameras to my home network as well.

Reviews.Title: Very negative review from an actual user.
Reviews.Author: doug n. "smoothy"
Reviews.Content: First of all allow the point that several of the reviews written here on Amazon to applaud the excellent customer service of Foscam are posted by people who have never posted a review before. Take away from that what you will but it makes me wonder how many of these hundreds of reviews are from actual customers.My own experience is that although when the camera functions it is great we do have a return rate so far of @40% (purchased 8 with 3 defective so far) and teetering on returning all of them. We've been testing and installing these over the last 10 days or so and have 4 up and functioning, 3 of them working fine. The problems on the ones we returned were right out of the box and have been various to the infra red feature not working, broken antennae, and pan not working.Now we have the technical/software problem that the cameras will flicker (the picture rapidly changes contrast) resulting in dozens of false motion alert emails sent. I learned through the Internet that one possible solution is to change the resolution settings from 640 to 320 and this seems to work. Unfortunately the cameras revert back to the 640 setting on their own. All attempts to reach Foscam fail. The telephone says "all circuits are busy" whenever I call, the chat offered on their website while it offers help when you submit a request an auto-responder replies "how may I help you?' but no one is there.The cameras are pretty cool and when they work it really solves an issue for us. Unfortunately when quality and service are this bad it can only mean that they are so busy they can't keep up or they don't care as they are going out of business. I don't think any company can survive on this extremely high return rate and lousy service too.

Reviews.Title: Great picture bad reception
Reviews.Author: S. A. Dexter
Reviews.Content: Love Foscam Cameras.  I have quite a few of their other models & was excited to use this one.  Has a great picture, night range is awesome but wouldn't connect to wireless then wouldn't hold connection.  Wasn't very far from wireless device so wasn't a range issue.  Needs better antennas possibly so not worth the dollars.

Reviews.Title: Four Foscam cameras and six failures
Reviews.Author: Alan J. Seibert
Reviews.Content: In a period of six months, I've had two FI8910W cameras fail by rebooting on their own and pointing upward after reboot despite having them set to not move after reboot. Both were replaced and I had to pay for the shipping. I had a FI8904W arrive DOA. I had to pay to have it returned. The replacement failed after one day. I had to pay to have it returned. The replacement lasted two weeks and failed. I had to pay to have it returned to get my money back. I had a FI8905W fail after 6 months. Foscam would replace it for a 15% restocking fee an I would have to pay to ship it back. I've given up on Foscam - their quality is atrocious but their prices are cheap. You get what you pay for with Foscam. I guess grief even has a price.

Reviews.Title: Adequate for the Price
Reviews.Author: bobf "bobf"
Reviews.Content: The camera was simple to set up and deploy.  I have only used it locally and have not tried to access it from a public location.  The wireless connection is good.  The picture is adequate considering the price.  The IR lighting is better than I expected. The mount, however, is not too good.  It limits the direction you can point the camera: if you try to mount it to a surface and point it in a direction that is not parallel or perpendicular, you will have problems.  One of the plastic caps on the gimble screw (to tighten the camera in the desired direction) has already broken from trying to tighten it enough to keep the camera from falling down under its own weight.  Obviously I'll have to make my own mount for a long term placement.  If you intend to move the camera several times while deciding on the ideal location, you can probably expect the mount to fail in some manner.The alarm function from movement in the camera field of view is minimal.  There is no ability to section off areas within the field of view. Also when it rained, the camera constantly alarmed.  If you set the sensitivity very low to stop the alarms, then you have to reset it after the rain stops.  I hadn't really thought about this, or expected it and I don't know if any camera software can take that into account to avoid constant adjustments.A robust mount and the ability to mark a section or sections of the camera field of view for alarms would have made this review a 5 instead of a 3 ... considering the low camera price.

Reviews.Title: Hours to configure and still not working?
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Ok, I bought this as what I thought was a relatively inexpensive, but solid solution for home security.  When I received it I decided to hook it up as wired on my desk at home with the expectation that once the kinks were worked out and I better understood the product I could remotely mount it in a wireless configuration.So it is now hardwired on my desktop and I find that it quits responding to the UI at times.  I can then attempt hard "reboots" of the camera (toggle power).  The bottom line is that the UI response is glitchy and at times goes away without letting you know whether your device configuration changes actually were saved.So getting past this obstacle, I got some configuration setting in and thought I would test it using an alarm to notify my gmail account. Ok, I enter configuration parameters for gmail (and the associated alarm settings) and press test (oh, but wait, you aren't supposed to press test unless you have saved the configuration settings first.  Ok, unsure of the state of the camera I restore factory defaults and proceed again.  As of this writing I don't have email alerts.The bottom line is that I am guessing that there is a way of making this camera (and it's associated features) work, but the cycle time between making changes and testing to see if it works is really long and I've wasted hours!As an added note, I am a software engineer.  A little rusty at networking topics but I understand the various protocols (dhcp, dns, ...)...

Reviews.Title: Does Exactly What it Says
Reviews.Author: Justin Buell
Reviews.Content: As mentioned multiple times, Foscam cameras require tech skills to setup, but they do exactly what they advertise.  This camera is great and has no trouble seeing our driveway etc at night.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible product and support
Reviews.Author: Jim B "Rechargable battery user"
Reviews.Content: Install SW is basically non function-able. It appears to install OK, but will not launch. Even after manually installing and getting it to run, it never finds the camera, even when the camera is connected by Ethernet line.No tech support phone number, other than international number to China. Never heard back from tech support e-mail. I have products I have been unhappy but never gave one a 1 star rating before.  Basically a worthless product.

Reviews.Title: Not what is advertised!
Reviews.Author: PJS3712
Reviews.Content: I decided to purchase this IP camera after looking at several on Amazon and others. Like most, seeing the price and what it comes with, I jumped on. The camera got delivered quickly and with no hassles. I connected it inside my home at my computer to make sure I had it configured right, all of my email and ftp settings were correct and it was ready. I then spent 5 hours connecting it outside where I wanted it, running the power up through the attic, running a new plug into the attic as I had none up there and turned it back on. Everything looked great until night time came. When I viewed the camera in the dark, I saw nothing! I knew it was functioning as I could barely make out a window frame in the pitch black viewer screen. No Night Vision!!! Now, I'm pretty good with this stuff and this is the 3rd camera I have setup; and the fact that the cameras title reads "Night Vision" I had assumed that Night Vision was part of the camera. Apparently not. Also, and this is an assumption I made, no PTZ. So now I need to return this camera. To do so, i have to unmount it from the house, and schlep back into the attic to get the power cord! Really a big pain. No more Agasio for me!

Reviews.Title: Bad feeling from the start
Reviews.Author: Sunset
Reviews.Content: I was suspicious from the beginning when removing from box and heard rattling like a screw loose inside.  I continued to connect and install and everything worked good for a few days and the picture was sharp.  Then, I couldn't get the wireless signal anymore.  I rebooted the device, reinstalled factory settings, spent a lot of time trying to make work to no avail (the ethernet connection did fine).  I had to send it back.  I found it to be a complicated process to install.  I don't recommend it to someone not familiar with networking and some associated terminology.  Even though the camera looks great, the quality is a little dubious - the base plate has a protrusion that prevents it from mounting flat in addition to the alleged internal loose screw.

Reviews.Title: I will never buy these foscam outdoor cameras again
Reviews.Author: Shoko
Reviews.Content: I buy the IF8905W that did not got IP-AddressI heard sound inside the camera body, I opened the CAM and found released crystal electronic part.I connect the crystal and It's start working but there was no colors.Because of the long distance (Middle East) I would not return it back and the support could not help.

Reviews.Title: Want a discusting live set-up of a camera
Reviews.Author: Theodore G. Hatter
Reviews.Content: When I purchased (big mistake)a live set-up for the cameras I thought great idea. Well I told the tech I wanted to connected on a wired setup. The tech book over my computer, made a lot of clicks said they would set them up as wireless and they did. I protested to no avail. Even after leaving me with a wireless set-up. they said the cameras worked fine and hung up. They did this leaving me with one of the cameras showing failure to access. I would not recommend the service or the cameras to one of my enemies. To add insult to the adventure the telephone connection was very poor and sounded like it was from India. Don't buy one.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8095W
Reviews.Author: Marcus Hammonds
Reviews.Content: Product works great.  I really didn't have any problems setting it up and getting it running.  Item was new in box.  Also, I received the shipment very quickly.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM should be renamed POSCAM.
Reviews.Author: David McNeill
Reviews.Content: I have purchased six POSCAMs from Amazon. I have three F18903W,two F18904W and one F18910W. The 03Ws are POS. One has LEDs failed and replaced by Amazon supplier, one was credited by Amazon and one just LED failed tonight. The 04W is working (one week) with good color an function, the second 04W has not been installed and the 10W is an inside camera with tilt and pan and functions properly when used intermittently. Never buy them from anyone but FOSCAM (even if via Amazon) because although the box says one year warranty no one will honor the warranty (not yet verified) unless purchased directly from FOSCAM. The 03Ws were purchased through Amazon and all failed within six months; only one 04W and one 10W are presently working. One the positive side , when they work they were relatively easy to setup. The 03Ws have bee withdrawn from the market. Have since replaced the 04W with an 05W 11/2012. It started failing 2/2013. NO ONE ANSWERS AT FOSCAM USA EVER, JUST "YOUR CALL WILL BE ANSWERED IN THE ORDER RECEIVED AND NEVER ANSWERED"

Reviews.Title: 12mm lens is a telephoto lens
Reviews.Author: theDeuce
Reviews.Content: Overall I am happy with my purchase. The point of this review is to mention the things I didn't know before purchase so you can make a wise choice.I didn't realize the 12mm lens is such a narrow view TELEPHOTO lens so I'll have to buy the $20 6mm lens (wide angle).  With the 12mm lens forget about getting video within 150 feet.  It's like looking through a straw. In fact, why would anyone want this lens for home use?Install the cam with the wired LAN cable, then setup wireless.  The unit has 2 MAC addresses, 1 for wired LAN and 1 for wireless.The cam is big.  Slightly smaller than 2 softballs side by side, larger than 2 baseballs side by side.  It will not be inconspicuous, but that's OK, maybe a potential intruder would see it and leave.Color quality and sharpness are OK, not great, but it's for security, not home movies.Like other reviewers, I don't like the red LED glow all nite at first, but maybe a potential intruder would see it and leave.Did I mention the 12mm lens is useless for home security use?  Use it for long distance viewing. (of several hundred feet!)Included software is bare bones, not intuitive and not for the pc timid or challenged.  Printed manual is written in Chinglish.It comes with a plain box and manual, no mention of the factory anywhere, but after spending 4 days to get to know this thing I believe it to be authentic Foscam.  The firmware and software is same current version as on Foscam website.I'll try to update this if any problems or surprises pop up.

Reviews.Title: horrible wireless range.
Reviews.Author: Tom Werner
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these to post outside on my garage after we had a break in.  The picture is choppy and I get about 70% packet loss on the wireless side of things. I'm reading -69dB at the lowest point which should be just fine with any wireless device.  I have a wireless camera in the garage and that one works fine even with the needed penetration through the walls.  I'm disappointed in these as the brand is normally good for the indoor ones but lacks the good to deliver on the outdoor variety.They are easy to setup and configure, good picture, decent night vision, but horrible for wireless.

Reviews.Title: very unsatisfied with this product *POOR*
Reviews.Author: Peter S Allain
Reviews.Content: I have to reboot it many times a day. Everything looks like its washed out and purple. I have many cams but wanted to try this one. Its a real shame because I need more and they wont have my business.

Reviews.Title: Wireless only worked intermitently
Reviews.Author: J. Sheppard
Reviews.Content: Got it up and running fairly easily under Windows 7.  When attached by wired/eithernet to LAN it worked fine, but wireless never worked consistently (dropped off line and/or was connected but no picture).  Daytime picture was completely washed out.  Night picture was good.  Returned since my plan was to use it wireless.

Reviews.Title: No warranty product
Reviews.Author: abuilder2
Reviews.Content: I ordered direct from Foscam where it stated the camera had a 1 year warranty.  When the camera quit working after 4 months I was told the best they could do was a 10% discount on a new camera.  I declined.  Junk is still junk even with a 10% discount.

Reviews.Title: Even more amazing
Reviews.Author: Rocknrotty
Reviews.Content: Again Purchased this with the 908 needed a cam that would be able to work a long ways away from router. The sales rep stated in his e-mail it would work up to 80 M or 280 ft i thought BS but price was right. Install was a breeze hooked it up with 2 100ft extension cords and started walking away from house By the time i got to the end I was about 250ft away from router through a forest, 50ft drop no line of site to router and this sucker still working. Going to be purchasing more of these. Nice to be able to log in to this cam from my Android or Iphone from any where there is an internet connection.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the money, but poor mechanicals
Reviews.Author: camp
Reviews.Content: Camera works well against specs. But, as others have mentioned, the bracket assembly supplied needs to be re-enfored with other brackets to stiffen up the camera during strong winds situations. Strongly suggest that the manufacturer provides a more robust bracket assembly

Reviews.Title: kinda sorta works
Reviews.Author: jburns
Reviews.Content: Its a low grade camera that is in a huge body. Don't plan on being discrete with this monster. If you look at the box the printer / manufacture doesn't have an English spell checker. They spell camera like this "camwra". Don't expect much and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect images day or night.  Just needs a wider viewing angle
Reviews.Author: locoluna69
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to watch our drive, parking and barn entry areas.  I have it mounted under eaves 40 feet off the ground.  It's about 60 feet from our barn entry area.  With the existing lens, the view is too narrow.I'll explore some different lenses to make this more usable.The images are perfect.  Day or night.  Absolutely amazing.  The LEDs certainly do light up a huge area.Network setup was trivial.  Plug it into a wired network switch.  Configure the wireless settings for SSID, authentication, etc.  Unplug from the wired network.  After that, it just works.The only gripe that I have is that the UI version is not the same as the pan/tilt cameras.  The email client will not work in its current state.  I think I probably just need to flash the camera to a more recent build.I certainly will be adding more cameras to our monitoring system.  The developer APIs are quite handy as well.

Reviews.Title: Mounting Problems
Reviews.Author: Patrick Burke
Reviews.Content: While the camera has a nice housing and it's advertised as an outdoor camera, the cabling makes it very difficult to actually mount outside and in accordance with any kind of electrical code.First off, the mount uses plastic wing nuts and whimpy hardware.  It's nearly impossible to tighten the mount enough to keep the camera from moving without stripping the threads.  Electrically the power, LAN and reset button are all wired into the same cable.  In addition, power is provided by an in-door wall transformer.  So you need a waterproof AC outlet AND someway to stow the exposed reset switch and LAN jack.  To date, I have not been able to find any type of reasonably sized electrical box that will work.  I may have to resort to one box to stow the cables next to an electrical outlet with an in-use type cover.  Also, the cable comes of the wall tranformer at the wrong angle and will require a dual-gang box for a single plug.  Completely unsightly and unacceptable.  Buyer beware.The software does not maintain users settings and must be reset everytime you open a browser session.  For example, I have multiple cameras, but everytime I open the browser it defaults to single camera view.  I also then have to re-establish settings for on-screen clock, border, etc.  The worst part is the software default is also camera NOT recording.  There also is no provision for recording to your PC's hard drive without opening a browser session.  So if your browser isn't running, you can't record to your PC.With some tweaks, this could be a great product, but the issues too many and too wide-ranging: software, hardware and electrical.  The camera does have a good picture, so if you just want a toy it's definitely fun to play with, but if you want a real maintenance free security system where you don't have to constantly go out and readjust the cameras, clean and seal connectors, and you want to actually capture a recording when something happens - this ain't it...I'm in too deep to start over, but if you're starting from scratch, think twice.

Reviews.Title: Best IP cam for the price
Reviews.Author: Tman
Reviews.Content: given the price, this cam serves well under a myriad of conditions. Most negative reviews stem from lack of user ability to setup dns accounts and from lack of understanding ip sys. Infantile to expect tech support for a $100 based in China.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera. Unfortunately, it didn't perform well.The infrared light beam is like a spot light and washes everything out in it's path.The light meter doesn't adjust properly when going from day to night or vice versa. Heck, it doesn't even adjust when it goes from morning to afternoon.The color is washed out and poor.The power adapter gets very hot.The mount for this camera looks like it'll snap in two. Very cheaply made.On the internet there are work arounds to reboot the camera and modify the parameters on a schedule. But, I didn't think I should have to do this with a brand new camera. By the way, the firm ware was up to date on this camera.The 2 stars are for the wireless connection. It was always there and strong. And, the housing for it is beefy. But then, almost all of these cameras look the same.Find another camera. Don't buy this one

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not great
Reviews.Author: Mark E. Ferris
Reviews.Content: My complaints are:1. I thought that motion activated meant it would start recording when it sensed motion. That is not what it does. You have to record constantly. This takes up a lot of space on your hard drive. If/when it senses motion, the software will flag the spot so it will be easy to find when you come back hours later to review the recording.2. The quality of the picture is very poor, regardless of the setting. Colors are very washed out. The trees look pink.But for less than $100, not bad.

Reviews.Title: Image with high contrast
Reviews.Author: Milena
Reviews.Content: The angle is not enough. It's very difficult to have a good image because most part of the time the contrast is very high. The image is poor when have shadows and sun at same time. The night vision is good. The red lights at the front are not discreet.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: bj1105
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this camera to monitor some property. First, it shipped very fast. Second, this camera is very easy to set up. This is my first IP Camera, and I had it set up in 5 mins. The instructions very detailed but had very broken English. I am very familiar with computers and networking, but I feel like anybody could set this up. In my preliminary test, the picture quality is great. I haven't tested it out during the day yet, but I will post an update e after a couple of weeks of use.  One reviewer mentioned that there was no auto brightness control. I am using Blue Iris software, and it has auto brightness control. I will update and let you know how this feature works with this camera. Overall, I have had this camera 1 day and it's already set up and ready to go. And the picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Great affordable camera
Reviews.Author: John F. Brehm
Reviews.Content: This camera does an amazing job considering how little it costs. I set it up to email me on motion detection, and although I get a couple of false emails occasionally, it still does a great job. I have 3 foscams now, one indoor and 2 out, and I feel better about leaving my house now. Setup the first time was a little hard but if you go to their website under the "support" section, there is a lot of help and if you actually thoroughly read the stuff (unlike myself), the answers are all there.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality & value!
Reviews.Author: W. Hudson
Reviews.Content: Yes, wireless setup will be difficult if you're not familiar with that sort of thing.If you've ever gone into your router settings to set something up, you won't have any trouble.The picture quality is great (both day & night)Haven't had any problems out of it in the heavy winds and rain other than it moving a little bit in high winds.I was concerned about buying the mjpeg instead of the H.264 which would be better, but considering the price and quality, I'm pleased with this one.*********************UPDATE*********Nov. 2011*******************After having the camera running 24/7 for about nine months now, the infrared is flashing off and on at night.The picture goes dark for about two seconds, then normal for two seconds.My recording software sees this as movement and records it.For the price, I may try buying this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Not bad...
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: I've never used a camera before so this was new to me.  After reading the reviews and thinking "what did I get myself into" - everything turned out OK, for my intended use which was to basically monitor the weather.  Actually setting it up, software-wise, worked fine.  The instructions are hard to follow, but...when I plugged everything in, it worked.  Since it was late fall and the weather had already turned here, I decided to keep it indoors.  The manual gives operating temps which don't confine to my area...where we sometimes can get well below 0.  Ive read some reviews where the temp doesn't seem to bother the operation.  Maybe this spring I will try to get it outside.  Inside looking out a window is ok, but at night the IR lights reflect back off the glass and u get the "flying saucer" for an image...until dawn when suddenly, poof, u have an image again.  The image quality is fine for my use...I didn't intend to have anything super high-speed for $100.  The cabling does have its drawbacks...its not a weatherproof connection so u only have about 3 ft of cable u can have outside.  Id say its the weakest part of the camera.  Even for wireless u still need the cable hooked up (for power) - so Im not really sure what the purpose of wireless even is, unless they have some sort of weather-proof extension cable.  But...for the price, it does fine.  Here is a link to the camera so u can see for yourself what it looks like:[...]All computers/networks are different.  Maybe I got lucky who knows!  For me, and the price, it was worth it - nothing happens at night here anyway!!Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tedd W. Gimber
Reviews.Content: This camera works as advertised and in fact the outdoor durability and the IR night vision are better than I expected.  I currently have the camera outside overlooking my back yard, exposed to the elements.  It has fared well in rain and snow.  We have had a few sub freezing days without ill effect to the camera's operation.  The software for the camera is PC based and I use mostly Mac's and Linux.  This is not an issue as the camera has a built in web server that is accessible via a browser.  Through that interface one may configure the camera as needed.  I'd definitely recommend this as an outdoor wireless webcam and I will probably buy a second one.

Reviews.Title: It's OK But Not Great
Reviews.Author: Fred "Tahoe"
Reviews.Content: I agree completely with all the other negative comments in the other reviews. Worse part for me is it does not seem to be reliable since I have had to reboot it a few times. Not good since I mainly want to view it when I am away from home. One good tip I found is that there is much better and updated documentation which can be downloaded from the Foscam web site.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for a hundred bucks
Reviews.Author: L. J. Cumbow
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer, I'm very technical, but it still took a little while to figure this thing out. It took a little forum surfing. I never bothered with the provided software because I bought this camera for use with zoneminder. First thing to do is connect it with an ethernet cable. Check your router to see what IP address your DHCP server (typically a router function) gave to the camera. Go to that address in your PC browser. Login to the camera with push mode (not ActiveX). Login with userid admin (no password).Assuming you want to run this thing wirelessly, go to the wireless lan setting section and scan twice (yes twice) for available networks. When you see yours, click on it to auto-fill the fields. Type in your key and click submit. While the camera is resetting, unplug the ethernet cable from the camera. Roughly 30 seconds later, the camera will have requested and received a new (and different) IP address from your router/DHCP-sever. Find that new address from your router interface and go to it in your browser to make sure it works. Now you can (finally) reserve that IP address in your router DHCP section so that whenever the camera (after being power cycled) requests a new IP address, the router will always give it the same one (based on the mac address). You can only do that AFTER you switch to wireless mode. If you do it before (while you are hard-wired), you will never get wireless to work. You will want to "DHCP-reserve" the IP address so that you can port-forward to it from the outside. Otherwise the camera IP address might move on you if you take a power hit (making port-forwarding dicey).As far as image goes, it's great - both daytime and nightime. (Much better than the D-Link DCS-930L simply because of better optics - The DCS-930L is indoor only and is much smaller though). The image is fixed and a bit zoomed, but that might be perfect for your application. You can replace the lens (saw it done in a youtube video) if you want a more fisheye effect. As I mentioned above, I have no idea how good the supplied software is since I don't use it. Zoneminder does all my motion detection and notification for me.If you're serious about monitoring, you should get a couple of UPSs to keep your PC and cameras running in case of power glitches. Of course, a generator will be necessary for more than about 30 minutes of power outage.

Reviews.Title: Great Hardware - HORRIBLE documentation
Reviews.Author: James E. Pearce
Reviews.Content: I've been in network services for 15 years, so I didn't have much trouble getting this camera working.  As others noted, if you haven't had experience in setting up a network device, you need a nerd or this camera isn't for you.The camera is great, and sets up easily if you know how, and looks to have very good quality.The user guide is HORRIBLE and doesn't explain even the most rudimentary features of the software.  Eg.  the device defaults to 60 hz. and if that sounds good to you, don't set up the camera to work in sunlight.  It will be very overexposed and can't be corrected.  The manual doesn't cover this, but there is a "daylight setting" which takes care of the problem.  And, there is no discussion in the manual of how to record the video of where the software puts the recording.  All of this, which should be covered in the manual, is doable.  But, you have to have a good understanding of computers, software, and networking to make this very good camera work. Lots of other features available - I'm dreading trying to make the motion detection work.  The manual doesn't explain any of this, whether the resulting image is a video or still, and what the duration of any recording is.  BAD!!!!Let me say that I got this camera to focus on a bird feeding station, and for that it works OK.  It seems to have a minimal focus of about 20 feet (designed to work as a surveillance camera in parking lots) and it would be nice if they put in an adjustable focus.  My birds are a little out of focus but very identifiable.  I may try putting a supplemental lens on to get the focus down to about 15 feet.Really good hardware, and I was able to get it going "out of the box", so it works.  The price is great for the camera.  But, again, if you don't know IP networking, you'll need a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Inexpensive
Reviews.Author: angirocks
Reviews.Content: Installation for this camera was done at 2 a.m. in just a few minutes.  I currently use verizon fios' router, so I was a little unsure what the quality would be like without a namebrand router.  The quality was great and the installation was a success.  I just followed the directions, plugged the camera via ethernet cable into the router and let it set itself up.  After it gave itself an IP address, all I really had to do was do some minor changes via the control address it gives you.Connectivity was simple after that. I mounted it to the front patio area, and it automatically connected itself. The mounting is kind of weird. I'm unsure how it will hold up to the wind.  The brackets are kind of flimsey and will move and the camera actually fell into my hands after mounting it up there. Just make sure it's as tight as it will go.  Currently, we use IP Camera for android (thanks to one of the previous reviewers who wrote about it) and we love it.  It is an easy app to install on any android device.  And don't worry I-phone users, i'm sure there is something out there just like this app. The price, you can't beat, and other than a minor interference from the baby monitor, this camera was running in no time.  I am planning on purchasing 8 more just like these!!!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Jayden Drager
Reviews.Content: I have ordered 6 cameras that were all foscam.  3 of the 6 didnt work.  First bad one worked for about 2 days and wifi went out.  had another that just quit working in general and i ordered another one and it wont scan for wifi settings.  These are extreamely hard to set up.  Not easy plug and play.  You really have to know your pc and ur modum and ip address and it is just a mess.  Dont recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Junk and wrong lens
Reviews.Author: Roger1
Reviews.Content: Description says 12mm lens.  Mine arrived with an 8mm lens.  Auto sensitivity control doesn't work, so images are washed out, sometimes completely white.  Camera has to be reset regularly.  This is also an older model without the IR cut filter.  Other users report that it works OK indoors.  Avoid this product for outdoor use.

Reviews.Title: DOA on arrival with loose screw and no US phone support
Reviews.Author: Pastense11
Reviews.Content: The unit would not connect using their software and heir software could not even make a connection when direct ethernet connected to the computer instead of through the router. It only showed one annonymous listing with an incorrect subnet. There is no US support and the only available number is in China. Total waste of time. The manual is written in awkward english and amateurish. They are trying to sell from China through channels here but with no support here.

Reviews.Title: 12 mm Lens (22° to 40° Viewing Angle)
Reviews.Author: Mark Maddox
Reviews.Content: How is this camera 12 mm Lens (22° to 40° Viewing Angle)???  According to the manufacture website the 12 mm lens is 22° viewing angle. The camera I received says 8mm lens which is 30° viewing angle.  I bought this camera for the 40° viewing angle... According to the manufacture website there is no 40° viewing angle lens, however there is a 6mm 42° viewing angle.Camera does not support wireless key with special characters.The camera mount barely holds the weight of the camera.If you can get over the items above the camera works as expected.

Reviews.Title: Nice value, but low on features and usability
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: For a WiFi IP camera, you really can't beat this price. However, I would like to see a more user-friendly interface and more advanced features.Pros:- Setup is not too difficult *if* you're IT-savvy.- Works with iPad and iPhone without any additional software (although some nifty apps are available).- Night vision works amazing well.Cons:- The built-in web pages are a little clunky. The text was clearly not written by a native English speaker.- The hard-wired cable has a bulky RJ-45 jack on it, requiring you to drill a 1.25" hole in the wall when mounting the camera. It would be better if you could simply drill a small hole that would perfectly fit the cord itself, and not have to allow for the whole jack.- The weight of the camera and position of the mounting holes means that you have to tighten the daylights out of the mounting hardware to prevent the camera from flopping around.- The motion detection lacks the ability to mask out parts of the image, making it unusable in many circumstances.- For WiFi, if your access point goes down you have to power cycle the camera to get it back online.Also note that the glowing red LEDs will be pretty noticeable at night. Personally, I think this might act as a deterrent, but some people might not like this.

Reviews.Title: Brightness Issue, maybe its all the snow?
Reviews.Author: Frank Troy
Reviews.Content: The issue I have with this camera is the camera is it seems to work fine indoors.  When I place it outside, it is overwhelmed by the sunlight.  Maybe it's because there is snow on the ground and lots of reflecting light, but I bought two of these and they both have the same problem.  The brightness settings don't help since the picture quality is terrible.  Sorry to say they are going back.

Reviews.Title: Have to reboot twice per day
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I owned 5 Foscam fi8918 models that I used indoors.  I thought they were great value and was very happy with them.  I decided to buy 2 outdoor models and have serious issues with them.  You basically have to reboot them twice per day.  They do not adjust to changes in light outside.  I reboot them at night and I get a good picture in the dark but than in the morning when the sun comes up, the picture is completely white and I mean completely white, nothing in the image can be picked out.  I have to reboot them to get a picture.  Then when night comes everything will turn completely black and I have to reboot them again.  Both cameras have the same problem and I have seen others complain of the same issue.  This problem makes the cameras completely useless.  I hope they offer a firmware update to address the issue.

Reviews.Title: Worst tech support ever - and the camera never worked
Reviews.Author: Evan Marwell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and followed the steps in the tutorials on the Foscam web site.  The first two steps (putting it on the network and then setting up wireless access) worked flawlessly. Unfortunately, the camera is useless if you can't enable it to be seen from the Internet.  Despite following all of the instructions and then paying for tech support, I was never able to get the camera onto the public Internet using port forwarding.The tech support was also horrendous.  They do not call when they say they will, repeatedly tell you it is your fault when they can't solve the problem, and rarely answer the phone when you try to call.  What's more, it is ridiculous that they will not even talk to you for tech support unless you pay - who does that for initial installations?  And the outsourced reps in india are not competent.I highly advise not buying this camera - buy from a company that know what they are doing and has support for their customers.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: JCR
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 each of Foscam models FI8910W and FI8905W. They been in service for over 2 months indoors and outdoors with no issues installing or performance wise. I got what I expected to get and that's a well rounded and somewhat inexpensive home surveillance system.  The star deduction is for poor swivel mounts and lack of decent software to unify a multi-camera system. I bought better mounts at a total cost of $20. I don't use Foscam's software at all. I went with a 3rd party vendor for an additional cost of $50 and everything is just how I want it.  Networking the cameras was easy and remote viewing works fine.  I also got an Android app to remotely view the live feeds for about $2.  I did use the internal server to configure automatic still image email and uploads to my ftp site in addition to what the 3rd party software does.  I do think that people who don't understand networking especially configuring routers would have some difficulty trying to set up multiple cameras, remote viewing, and things like that.  That's just the nature of how all of these things work however.  If a persons only experience with routers is plugging one in to a cable/DSL modem and setting up DHCP they will probably need some help figuring out how to make things work.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected and poor quality
Reviews.Author: Sophtware "Michael Lange"
Reviews.Content: First off, right out of the box the ethernet cable was broke and I had to use one of my own. Setting up the camera wasn't too difficult. But would probably be extremely hard for a novice. The software that comes with the camera is quite old and didn't display correctly on my Win 7 Pro machine, while the browser interface displayed ok.With that said, I took the camera outside to get a feel for the outdoor performance before I installed it. I was very disappointed in the image quality. Today is overcast, but is still very light outside. The camera's images was poor at best. Very dark and shadowy.Also, I purchased the 3.6mm wide angle version so I could get a lot of my yard. I would hate to see what the non-wide angle versions look like. The image coming from this camera looked like it was looking down a hallway with nothing visible on the left or right.I would not recommend this camera for any purpose. Save your money and get a real security system.

Reviews.Title: Foscan warranty
Reviews.Author: Diane "Diane"
Reviews.Content: I have 6 Foscam cameras (4 outside and 2 inside). One of the outside cameras quit working and I contacted the reseller who no longer sells Foscam cameras (wonder why?). He said he could not exchange the camera but would give me $30 to call it even. I paid over $100 for each camera. I contacted Foscam in China, who after several emails, said they would exchange the camera after I sent it to them at my expense. And the return to me would be at my expense. So I would be spending $120 to return a broken camera to have it fixed and returned to me when I could buy a new camera for $100 or less now. I will be replacing my Foscam cameras with an American manufactured camera that honors its warranties.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera, especially for security.
Reviews.Author: brotherbuck
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for security around my home, especially when I am not home. It has a motion setting so it will start to record when it senses movement. However, this "pos" records when there is not any thing moving. So what you have 480 minutes of video to go through and maybe half have something them on it. It will also not detect all movement.  I wanted to see if it was something maybe I could not see, like a bug that flew through the lense's range. So I put it in a interior closet, pitch black, and left it there for one day. When I checked the system later I had 423 minutes of recordings. The video was of nothing but blackness. The movement that is not detected is worse, if you are using the camera for security. Every morning the paper boy delivers the paper and throws it right on the driveway. The camera is pointing right at the place the paper boy is stopping his car to throw the paper and I have never got a video of it. I know other things go through the same spot and the camera picks them up. I would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A waste of money
Reviews.Author: B. Alley
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in October of 2011 from Amazon.  Initially it worked just fine except that the color presentation was horrible.  But I didn't buy it for that, I bought it for the night vision capability and the movement alerting function which worked just fine.  By spring of this year, just about 6 months, the camera started dropping off the network.  In the process it would screw up the router and force me to have to reboot the router and the camera.  I even tried a different router and had the same problem.  For a long while, booting the camera by powering it off fixed the problem. But now the camera appears to be dead.I thought I had a 1 year warranty.  Wrong.  It would seem that the warranty is only valid if you purchase the camera from the Foscam web site.  If you don't and if you camera dies, it's your loss.Save the money.  Buy some other brand.  These are cheap cameras that aren't worth a dime.UPDATE: check FOSCAM on the Better Business Bureau web site ([...]).  Their rating is: F !  I should have checked this before buying the cam.

Reviews.Title: worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: goose
Reviews.Content: wifi drops constantly.  Camera only works well when wired.  customer support is non existant and they don't return your calls or emails.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: John Poindexter
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how good this camera worked.  At $105, I wasn't expecting much, but this camera delivers.  The color isn't very good at night, but it's amazing how well the nightvision works. I already have ordered another.

Reviews.Title: No success with F18905W
Reviews.Author: Glyn Rimmington "Rimmo"
Reviews.Content: If you are in search of the most frustrating experience ever, buy one of these. The instruction manual is not in comprehensible English. The downloadable installation guide and manual are no better. The Foscam web server foscam.us is either down or so slow the browser times out. They do have a forum for registered users, but nobody including their moderators or administrators bothers to answer any questions. There are youtube videos and blog entries, but it appears nobody has managed to get one of these to work across the Internet. I can see it within the LAN, but after trying every method available to make it visible outside the LAN, I came to a dead end.My recommendation is to avoid FOSCAM or any of their products like the black plague!

Reviews.Title: Washes out
Reviews.Author: IowaBill
Reviews.Content: I had to send this camera back.  It is advertised as an outdoor camera but it just couldn't deal with the sunlight outdoors.  The image completely washed out.  It was fine indoors, but even just aiming it out the window the image turned to complete white.  There is a brightness setting in the software, but that had little effect. Granted, it was winter with snow on the ground. Also, I missed the specs for the min operating temperature, so it probably wouldn't work here in the winter anyway. Perhaps in a warm climate that gets no snow, it might work.

Reviews.Title: Foscams rule!
Reviews.Author: Michael U.
Reviews.Content: Great camera fourth of several more to come, very sturdy, easy to install, love it! Came fast and with everything I needed love my foscams.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, some network configuration
Reviews.Author: Anthony G. Picciano
Reviews.Content: We love this camera. The clarity and night vision work very well. So far it sems to be tolerating our Colorado weather extremes.Keep in mind that you will need to do some network configuration to get the most out of this camera. If setting up static IPs for devices based on the MAC address, DDNS, and SMTP configuration is your cup of tea, by all means go for it. I think the effort was was it as I can stream to multiple mobile devices from anywhere now. It sends me emails when motion is detected and even registers itself with the Foscam-provided DDNS servers.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for remote monitoring of family camp.
Reviews.Author: Ryan Elder
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for a friend that required a fair to moderate quality camera, that had wireless access without a dedicated wifi bridge expense. It has worked great all around. Considering additional ones for other areas.

Reviews.Title: Great video but...
Reviews.Author: Rick Hansen "RickH"
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked well once it was setup however, the email motion alarm was a bear to get working.  No help whatsoever from Foscam.  It took a major effort to get the email alarm to work and had to try several SMTP services before finding one that would work.I could not get email alarms to work when connected wirelessly so I connected a cable and started getting email alarms.  Basically this defeated the whole purpose of having a WIRELESS camera...

Reviews.Title: I own 2, but prefer the Dericam version
Reviews.Author: dcg "dcg"
Reviews.Content: I've got two of these.  They're solidly built and do what they should do.  With a 1-year warranty - and one that requires that you go through the retail channel (can't return direct to the manufacturer) - just be aware of what you're buying... Buy direct if you want support or think you're might have to return.Of the 2, they've been reliable.  The only problem I have is that one power supply (transformer) died at 14 months.  I replaced the 5V 2A power supply and we're back in business.Both have what I'd call "marginal" focus, but it could just be general picture quality.  You're not going to be making out license plate numbers.For outdoor, wireless, IR-capable cameras, they're inexpensive.  Note, they have a fairly narrow width, probably due to IR.In terms of picture quality - I strongly prefer the Dericam H216W.  It has much better resolution for around $95.  The Dericam support is direct from China, so don't buy one of either unless you understand basic networking and setup.The power supplies get warm, they're 5v @ 2amps.  Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: Camera works great and has a good quality image
Reviews.Author: Arty--
Reviews.Content: Camera has a good view area and quality image and is easy to setup. I work with networks but there is nothing complex about getting this setup. Worked with my first guess at the settings without reading any docs.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, good instructions.
Reviews.Author: Mary Z Middleton
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and has a good quality image. Instructions come in PDF form on a CD, they are well illustrated and detailed. Setting up email alerts was very quick and easy.If you are using a Apple OS X platform, you don't get all the software features (such as  recording) that are on the Windows version of the Foscam software, but you can buy better software to control all the features of the camera for about $30..

Reviews.Title: great item to keep an eye on things
Reviews.Author: Laura J. Tai
Reviews.Content: does the job, wish I had researched for a scanning model, but it does the job.  image is clear; I do have one which is not as clear and need to research it further.  Set up was not too complicated but you do have to understand what you are doing.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera, terrible usability
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: This is only a decent camera. It could probably be a lot better if the manufacturer put any thought into the software part of the product. Do not expect to get clear photos of anyone's face, as the image compression is extremely high and un-configurable. Do not expect to receive email updates when motion is detected - this feature is so useless that you will get 100 emails per day due to tree branches moving and lighting changes. You cannot save video without a lot of hassle with third-party software. All of the configuration options for the camera are poorly conceived and designed. This is a good example of a hardware company having little to no proficiency in software design.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Michael Cyhaniuk
Reviews.Content: Technical help is fantastic. Thomas, the tech support person, was extremely helpful in setting up the camera wirelessly and with my connection to my IPad. Don't hesitate to call for their help.

Reviews.Title: Good For The Money
Reviews.Author: Harry Binder
Reviews.Content: Easy to Install using provided software utility and following simple instructions.  I thought the camera mount could have been a better quality.  The mount required quite a bit of force to prevent the camera view from a change.  Picture quality good and has been reliable in full weather exposure.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy, works well.
Reviews.Author: John Doe123 "pizan99"
Reviews.Content: Overall, works well and seems sturdy. No problems with weather but I would suggest keeping it under a ledge. In tight areas the resolution/quality is ok but if you might want an HD model with a wider lens for further views and better quality.

Reviews.Title: You Get Your Money's Worth
Reviews.Author: GWT
Reviews.Content: For under a hundred dollars, you get a lot for your money - Wireless, ethernet, IR, weatherproof, motion detection, viewing software, smartphone app, detailed instructions on how to get this camera working at home and over the Internet. Is it the best picture out there? No, but for less than a Ben Franklin, you get all of the above. Expect a little washout on light colored objects exposed to bright sunlight. You can still decipher the object but the clarity will be missing as it becomes brighter/whiter than it really is. This is more of a problem for objects close to the camera, like 10-15 feet and is not as bad for distant, white objects. The night vision is acceptable. Mine came with the 4mm lens which I was hoping would give wider angle view than what it delivers but I guess that's what you get with a 4mm. I've seen 2.8mm replacement lens for sale on eBay.  I had no issues getting the software to find the camera over a wireless network. However, I did the initial setup over Ethernet. The Android app works great and my Synology NAS plays perfectly well with this camera. So, don't buy this camera expecting perfection in all areas. You'll need to pay two to three times this price to obtain that. For the price, this is a 5 star camera. If I had paid double for this camera, I'd given it 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Equipment great; company employees ????
Reviews.Author: Maub001
Reviews.Content: Buying through Amazon, is a must......camera works well and it's operation is as described; no surprises! Buying directly from Foscam, is a nightmare and you can not trust what they represent when it comes to delivery; they will lie!

Reviews.Title: Poor tech support from Foscam
Reviews.Author: Mike in Texas
Reviews.Content: Good general purpose outdoors camera. Seems to work better at night with the 60 IR emitters. Numerous false alarms during the day. Be advised I received a nonstandard firmware directly from amazon, foscam refused to proves tech support to me,  so I sent back to amazon. By the way the tech support from foscam is the worst I've ever experienced, I hope you don't need any manufacture!

Reviews.Title: decent for what it is
Reviews.Author: payaintworthit
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills IP camera.  My only gripe was that I wish it had a slightly larger viewing area and that its online interface was a bit more polished.  Make sure you set your computer's IP to something other than 192.168.1.1 before connecting to the camera.  It'll save a lot of headaches.Also, be aware that the camera takes about a minute to reset itself just about every time you do something.  I wasn't aware of this and almost thought I had a dud. It works great and I have not had to power cycle it since I first got it set up.  Can't say the same for my routers / wds bridge that connect to it.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: J. Aman "flippy"
Reviews.Content: A little glitchy, but it does work.  I've had mine for more than a year and it still works good.

Reviews.Title: Overall very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Zkoontz
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd outdoor Foscam camera I've purchased. I also have 2 Foscam indoor pan/tilt cameras. Overall, for the money, this is a very good value, especially when paired with Foscam's Blue Iris software. Over the past week or so, I've been obsessed with tweaking Blue Iris settings and trying different things. I think I have it set up just how I want it now. I have all 4 cameras on different schedules on when to trigger motion/record/alert. I have an email sent to me when motion is triggered and the email also includes a 15 second clip of what it saw after the motion triggered.The quality of the video is great during the day, and, for the price, not bad at night. the only problem I have is when the infrared led's are on, a person's face is brightly illuminated so that you can't really tell who the person is. I haven't been able to find a setting to change that, but I'm sure there probably is one.Unless you just want to be able to look at your cameras every now and then, Foscam's Blue Iris software is a must buy. At about $40 for the software on Windows, and $10 for the mobile app, it doesn't get much better. Through the mobile app (I have Android) you can pause motion detection and alerting, and watch all the recorded clips saved on your server, along with many other options.I have both outdoor cameras set up on WiFi, although I would like them to be wired, it just wasn't feasible with my house setup. I have an indoor camera wired and I don't notice a difference between that and the wireless ones. Note that this camera doesn't support the 5Ghz frequency though.Setup can be a bit much if you aren't technically inclined. I never had to call Foscam's tech support, but I hear they are helpful in other reviews.
